intro: Lobelia haenkeana var. panamensis, commonly known as Panama lobelia, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy blue to violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Lobelia haenkeana var. panamensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
